item.title: Not reinstated after 6 months, 11th March
item.description:
///bonds.fines.bottom is the w3w location Cheltenham Civic Society has repeatedly asked that this reinstatement be done ASAP (as is required by law). Not only has that not been done but 6 months has now [also] elapsed. What action will you now take both to resolve the issue and to ensure that contractors carry out their legal duties? This mess was created on 6th September 2023 and just left like that for 6 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambray Place, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building site, 11th March
item.description:
Building site not road sweeping it's gone from black to brown ðŸŸ¤ due lack of sweeping off site my car was valeted to return to dealer on Thursday had to go back Saturday as car swap was Sunday gone
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crown Drive, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet again - this problem has NOT been fixed (4th report), 11th March
item.description:
This is (at least) the 4th time exactly the same problem has been reported since December. Banging manhole cover in Cheltenham-bound carriageway. Highways keeps patching the road surface with tarmac, but this does not fix the problem (the banging manhole cover), which is now a long-term noise nuisance to residents. Almost every vehicle drives over it, causing loud banging that can be heard from approx 600m away. Please fix this problem PROPERLY.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A435, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 11th March
item.description:
Customer has reported that the pedestrian crossing keeps making the traffic lights go red, for pedestrians to cross, but there are no pedestrians, no-one is pushing the button, and the traffic lights keep going to red, to stop the cars.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Wide shallow hole on footpath ABC13 between the Church and Station Road, 11th March
item.description:
The pot hole, and several smaller ones are about halfway down the 'Coffin Path', footpath ABC13, between the back of St. Michael's and All Angels Church and Station Road in Bishop's Cleeve. The path is used frequently by our more elderly residents and several have repoerted tripping in this area. It has become larger sincethe recent rains.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Station Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights at Hucclecote Road/Churchdown Lane not staying green for long enough moving towards Brockworth from Hucclecote resulting in a back up of traffic along Hucclecote Road, 11th March
item.description:
Hucclecote Road/Churchdown Lane/Carisbrooke Road junction lights Following recent relaying of the road, the lights no longer seem to be phased equally which means only a few cars a let through going towards Brockworth from Hucclecote. Thus is causing significant build ups along Hucclecote Road at busy times
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Carisbrooke Road, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
